plantType: Classify {{plantName}} by its dominant growth habit or planting form.
Return a single lowercase string chosen from: "plant", "flower", "bamboo", "shrub", "tree", "cactus", "succulent".
If the plant doesn't clearly fit one category, use "plant" as the default.
utility: List every practical or ornamental role {{plantName}} is commonly grown for.
Return an array of lowercase tags selected from: "comestible", "ornemental", "produce_fruit", "aromatic", "medicinal", "odorous", "climbing", "cereal", "spice".
Include all that genuinely apply based on documented uses.
comestiblePart: Identify which anatomical parts of {{plantName}} are safely edible.
Return an array whose values are limited to: "flower", "fruit", "seed", "leaf", "stem", "root", "bulb", "bark", "wood".
Return an empty array if the plant is not edible.
fruitType: Describe the fruiting category for {{plantName}} if it produces harvestable fruit.
Return an array containing any applicable values from: "nut", "seed", "stone".
Use an empty array when the plant does not produce fruit.
seasons: Indicate the seasons when {{plantName}} looks most attractive or is at peak performance.
Return an array of capitalized season names chosen from: "Spring", "Summer", "Autumn", "Winter".
Include all seasons where the plant provides visual interest or is actively growing.
description: Write a cohesive horticultural overview for {{plantName}} that highlights appearance, growth habit, bloom/fruit interest, and essential care.
Use 150-300 words of prose (no bullet lists or headings) and keep the tone factual and neutral.
Focus on what makes this plant distinctive and its primary uses in gardens or homes.
identity: Populate the `identity` object for {{plantName}} with authoritative taxonomy and naming information.
- `givenNames`: array of common names (e.g., ["Snake Plant", "Mother-in-law's Tongue"])
- `overview`: 2-3 sentence summary distinct from the main description
- `promotionMonth`: integer 1-12 for when the plant should be featured, or null
- `toxicityHuman`: EXACTLY one of: "Non-Toxic", "Midly Irritating", "Highly Toxic", "Lethally Toxic"
- `toxicityPets`: EXACTLY one of: "Non-Toxic", "Midly Irritating", "Highly Toxic", "Lethally Toxic"
- `allergens`: array of allergen names or empty array
- `multicolor`: boolean - REQUIRED, set true if plant has 3+ distinct colors, false otherwise
- `bicolor`: boolean - REQUIRED, set true if plant has exactly 2 colors, false otherwise
- `scent`: boolean (true if plant has notable fragrance)
Use concise values grounded in reputable botanical sources. Do NOT use values outside the specified options.
plantCare: CRITICAL: You MUST populate ALL of these fields with the EXACT value formats specified:
- `habitat`: array from ONLY these values: ["Aquatic", "Semi-Aquatic", "Wetland", "Tropical", "Temperate", "Arid", "Mediterranean", "Mountain", "Grassland", "Forest", "Coastal", "Urban"] - REQUIRED
- `levelSun`: EXACTLY one of: "Low Light", "Shade", "Partial Sun", "Full Sun" - REQUIRED
- `watering`: object containing a `schedules` array where EACH entry is shaped EXACTLY like:
- `quantity` must be an integer (number of times to water)
- `soil`: array from ONLY: ["Vermiculite", "Perlite", "Sphagnum moss", "rock wool", "Sand", "Gravel", "Potting Soil", "Peat", "Clay pebbles", "coconut fiber", "Bark", "Wood Chips"]

- `mulching`: array from ONLY: ["Wood Chips", "Bark", "Green Manure", "Cocoa Bean Hulls", "Buckwheat Hulls", "Cereal Straw", "Hemp Straw", "Woven Fabric", "Pozzolana", "Crushed Slate", "Clay Pellets"]

- `fertilizer`: array from ONLY: ["Granular fertilizer", "Liquid Fertilizer", "Meat Flour", "Fish flour", "Crushed bones", "Crushed Horns", "Slurry", "Manure", "Animal excrement", "Sea Fertilizer", "Yurals", "Wine", "guano", "Coffee Grounds", "Banana peel", "Eggshell", "Vegetable cooking water", "Urine", "Grass Clippings", "Vegetable Waste", "Natural Mulch"]
Keep recommendations practical and consistent with the plant's native environment. Do NOT invent values outside the specified options.
growth: Detail the growth and propagation profile for {{plantName}}.
- `fruitingMonth`: array of integers 1-12 (empty array if no fruit)
Use realistic numbers based on horticultural references.
usage: Summarize how people cook with, medicate with, or otherwise use {{plantName}}.
- `adviceMedicinal`: string describing traditional medicinal uses (or empty string if none)
- `infusionMix`: Record<string, string> where keys are mix names and values are benefits
Example: {"Chamomile blend": "Calming digestive tea", "Mint refresh": "Cooling effect"}
- `recipesIdeas`: array of dish ideas (e.g., ["Pesto", "Salad garnish", "Herbal butter"])
If certain uses are not documented, use empty arrays/strings instead of inventing data.
ecology: Capture {{plantName}}'s ecological value and environmental needs.
- `melliferous`: boolean (true if provides nectar for pollinators)
- `beFertilizer`: boolean (true if can be used as compost/fertilizer)
- `groundEffect`: string describing environmental benefits (erosion control, nitrogen fixing, etc.)
Note wildlife relationships when credible data exists.
danger: List the main pests and diseases that threaten {{plantName}}.
- `pests`: array of pest names (common or scientific, e.g., ["Aphids", "Spider mites", "Mealybugs"])
- `diseases`: array of disease names (e.g., ["Powdery mildew", "Root rot", "Leaf spot"])
Only include issues that are well-documented for this species. Use empty arrays if none are documented.
miscellaneous: - `companions`: array of COMMON NAMES of plants that either:
(1) grow well alongside this plant (companion planting), or
(2) are related varieties/cultivars (e.g., for 'Rose', include 'Rose Iceberg', 'Rose Peace')
- `sources`: array of citation objects shaped like {"name":"Royal Horticultural Society","url":"https://www.rhs.org.uk/"}
Use standard common names for companions so they can be matched to database entries.
Prefer high-quality references and avoid duplicates.
meta: When meta data is requested for {{plantName}}, only populate editorial helper fields.
Return an object that may include:
Leave other fields (status, timestamps, createdBy, updatedBy) untouched unless explicitly provided.
meaning: Summarize the symbolic meaning of {{plantName}} in under 50 words.
Focus on emotions, ceremonies, or cultural themes backed by botanical folklore.
Do not include care advice or lists.
